metadata.title: CVE-2024-7348 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in pg_dump in PostgreSQLallows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the userrunning pg_dump, which is often a superuser. The attack involves replacinganother relation type with a view or foreign table. The attack requireswaiting for pg_dump to start, but winning the race condition is trivial ifthe attacker retains an open transaction. Versions before PostgreSQL 16.4,15.8, 14.13, 13.16, and 12.20 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm8').
